KSE PWSLIB 2-3-1

SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.jpws.pwslib.data
Class PwsFileFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFileFactory

public final class PwsFileFactory
extends java.lang.Object

This is a singleton factory class used to load and save PasswordSafe files. It is capable of detecting file format versions and handling differences appropriately. All three major file formats (referred to as V1, V2 and V3) can be read and written.

The field type constants are provided public for the convenience of those who attempt to interpret the block data stream of a PWS file in their own fashion.

Header Fields as Save Parameter

Since 2-0-0 the save methods feature a parameter headerFields to allow application specific supply of file header data in the context of V3 databases. For a target file of format version V2 only field type PwsFileHeaderV3.JPWS_OPTIONS_TYPE is extracted from the header field list. A target file V1 does not interpret the header fields at all.

The file and record format that this factory complies with is PWS 3.6.

Author:
Wolfgang Keller
See Also:
HeaderFieldList, ApplicationAdapter, PwsPassphrase

Method Detail

loadFile

public static final PwsFile loadFile(java.lang.String filepath,
                                     PwsPassphrase passphrase)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     PasswordSafeException
Loads a PWS file of any format from the standard application adapter (by default the local file system).

Parameters:
filepath - the pathname of the file to open
passphrase - the file access passphrase
Returns:
the opened, fully operable PwsFile object
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any param is undefined
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filepath is empty
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the specified file was not found or access was denied
InvalidPassphraseException - if file access could not be verified
ApplicationFailureException - if the specified IO-context does not render an input stream
java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurred
PasswordSafeException

loadFile

public static final PwsFile loadFile(ContextFile file,
                                     PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                                     int format)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     PasswordSafeException
Loads a PWS file of a specific format from a file specified by a ContextFile parameter. (If a format other than 0 is specified, loading will fail if the referred persistent state is of a different format.)

Parameters:
file - ContextFile the file in an application context
passphrase - the user passphrase for the file
format - the file format version (values of Global), 0 for a generic open request (any version)
Returns:
the opened, fully operable PwsFile object
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any param is undefined
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any filepath is empty
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the specified file was not found or access was denied
InvalidPassphraseException
WrongFileVersionException - if a specific format was requested and not found to match the file
UnsupportedFileVersionException - if the requested format is unknown
ApplicationFailureException - if the specified IO-context does not render an input stream
java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurred
PasswordSafeException
Since:
2-1-0

loadFile

public static final PwsFile loadFile(java.io.InputStream in,
                                     PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                                     int format)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     PasswordSafeException
Loads a PWS file of a specific format from a user input stream. Note that persistent state definition is void in returned object. (If a format other than 0 is specified, loading will fail if the pesistent state is of a different format.)

Parameters:
in - InputStream containing persistent state of the file
passphrase - the user passphrase for the file
format - the file format version (values of Global), 0 for a generic open request (any version)
Returns:
the opened, fully operable PwsFile object
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any param is undefined
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any filepath is empty
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the specified file was not found or access was denied
InvalidPassphraseException
WrongFileVersionException - if a specific format was requested and not found to match the file
UnsupportedFileVersionException - if the requested format is unknown
ApplicationFailureException - if the specified IO-context does not render an input stream
java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurred
PasswordSafeException
Since:
2-0-0

saveFile

public static final UUID saveFile(java.util.Iterator records,
                                  java.lang.String filepath,
                                  PwsPassphrase pass,
                                  HeaderFieldList headerFields,
                                  int iterations,
                                  int format)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  ApplicationFailureException
Creates a persistent state of a PWS file of a specified format version from a record list defined through an iterator whose elements are of type PwsRecord. The destination of the file is determined by a filepath in the context of the standard application (by default the local file system). The user's file access key is passed in through a PwsPassphrase.

If the file exists prior to writing, overwriting only occurs after an intermediary copy of the output has been created successfully. (This safety copy has the ending ".temp" trailing the parameter filepath.)

Parameters:
records - Iterator with element type PwsRecord or null for empty database
filepath - the target file path valid in the standard IO-context (by default the local file system)
pass - the user's file access passphrase (secret key)
headerFields - header field list to be included in the file or null
iterations - number of security key calculation iterations
format - the file format version (values of Global) (0 defaults to latest version)
Returns:
UUID the file identifier value of the saved file or null if unavailable
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any essential parameter is not defined
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filepath is empty
ApplicationFailureException - if the IO-context does not render an output stream
java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs
Since:
2-1-0

saveFile

protected static final UUID saveFile(java.util.Iterator records,
                                     ApplicationAdapter app,
                                     java.lang.String filepath,
                                     PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                                     HeaderFieldList headerFields,
                                     int iterations,
                                     int format)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     ApplicationFailureException
Creates a persistent state of a PWS file of a specified format version from a record list defined through an iterator whose elements are of type PwsRecord. The destination of the file is determined by an ApplicationAdapter and a filepath. The user's file access key is passed in through a PwsPassphrase. Records are stored only if they qualify for validity ("isValid() == true"); invalid records are silently ignored.

If the file exists prior to writing, overwriting only occurs after an intermediary copy of the output has been created successfully. (This safety copy has the ending ".temp" trailing the parameter filepath.)

Parameters:
records - Iterator with element type PwsRecord or null for empty database
app - the ApplicationAdapter IO-context
filepath - the target file path valid in IO-context
passphrase - the user's file access key (secret key)
headerFields - header field list to be included in the file or null
iterations - number of security key calculation iterations
format - the file format version (values of Global) (0 defaults to latest version)
Returns:
UUID the file identifier value of the saved file or null if unavailable
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any essential parameter is not defined
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filepath is empty
ApplicationFailureException - if the specified IO-context does not render an output stream
java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs
Since:
2-1-0

saveFile

public static final UUID saveFile(java.util.Iterator records,
                                  ContextFile file,
                                  PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                                  HeaderFieldList headerFields,
                                  int iterations,
                                  int format)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  ApplicationFailureException
Creates a persistent state of a PWS file of a specified format version from a record list defined through an iterator whose elements are of type PwsRecord. The destination of the file is determined by a ContextFile parameter. The user's file access key is passed in through a PwsPassphrase.

If the file exists prior to writing, overwriting only occurs after an intermediary copy of the output has been created successfully. (This safety copy has the ending ".temp" trailing the parameter filepath.)

Parameters:
records - Iterator with element type PwsRecord or null for empty database
file - ContextFile the target file in an application context
passphrase - the user's file access key (secret key)
headerFields - header field list to be included in the file or null
iterations - number of security key calculation iterations
format - the file format version (values of Global) (0 defaults to latest version)
Returns:
UUID the file identifier value of the saved file or null if unavailable
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any essential parameter is not defined
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filepath is empty
ApplicationFailureException - if the specified IO-context does not render an output stream
java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs
Since:
2-1-0

saveFile

public static final UUID saveFile(java.util.Iterator records,
                                  java.io.OutputStream out,
                                  PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                                  HeaderFieldList headerFields,
                                  int iterations,
                                  int format)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Creates a persistent state of a PWS file of a specified format version from a record list defined through an iterator whose elements are of type PwsRecord. The destination of the file is the parameter output stream, which is not closed upon termination of this operation! The user's file access key is passed in through a PwsPassphrase.

Parameters:
records - Iterator with element type PwsRecord or null for empty database
out - a target output stream
passphrase - the user's file access key (secret key)
headerFields - RawFieldList with file specific data (e.g. user options) or null
iterations - number of security key calculation iterations
format - the file format version (values of Global) (0 defaults to latest version)
Returns:
UUID the file identifier value of the saved file or null if unavailable
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if out or passphrase is not defined
java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs
Since:
2-1-0

isCanonicalField

public static boolean isCanonicalField(int type,
                                       int format)
Whether the parameter field type is a canonical field (conventional meaning) in the context of the given file format.

Parameters:
type - the field type in question
format - the reference file format or 0 for default
